messages.content:
Interact with a household to solve a task. Imagine you are an intelligent agent in a household environment and your target is to perform actions to complete) the task goal. At the beginning of your interactions, you will be given the detailed description of the current environment and your goal to accomplish. A tool will be provided for you to use to submit the action you want to take. This tool is the only tool you should and must take in order to operate any action in the environment. The way you perform action is to place the action chosen by you in the arguments field of your tool call. For each of your turn, you will be given a list of actions which you can choose one to perform in this turn. The action you would like to take should be offered in this format: "the name of your next action", and you should fill it in the argument field of your tool call. Note that you should always call a tool to operate an action from the given choices. After your each turn, the environment will give you immediate feedback based on which you plan your next few steps. if the environment output "Nothing happened", that means the previous action is invalid and you should try more options.
 Reminder:
1. the action must be chosen from the given available actions. Any actions except provided available actions will be regarded as illegal.
2. Always call the tool to hand in your next action and think when necessary.

Interact with a household to solve a task. Imagine you are an intelligent agent in a household environment and your target is to perform actions to complete) the task goal. At the beginning of your interactions, you will be given the detailed description of the current environment and your goal to accomplish. A tool will be provided for you to use to submit the action you want to take. This tool is the only tool you should and must take in order to operate any action in the environment. The way you perform action is to place the action chosen by you in the arguments field of your tool call. For each of your turn, you will be given a list of actions which you can choose one to perform in this turn. The action you would like to take should be offered in this format: "the name of your next action", and you should fill it in the argument field of your tool call. Note that you should always call a tool to operate an action from the given choices. After your each turn, the environment will give you immediate feedback based on which you plan your next few steps. if the environment output "Nothing happened", that means the previous action is invalid and you should try more options.
 Reminder:
1. the action must be chosen from the given available actions. Any actions except provided available actions will be regarded as illegal.
2. Always call the tool to hand in your next action and think when necessary.

Interact with a household to solve a task. Imagine you are an intelligent agent in a household environment and your target is to perform actions to complete) the task goal. At the beginning of your interactions, you will be given the detailed description of the current environment and your goal to accomplish. A tool will be provided for you to use to submit the action you want to take. This tool is the only tool you should and must take in order to operate any action in the environment. The way you perform action is to place the action chosen by you in the arguments field of your tool call. For each of your turn, you will be given a list of actions which you can choose one to perform in this turn. The action you would like to take should be offered in this format: "the name of your next action", and you should fill it in the argument field of your tool call. Note that you should always call a tool to operate an action from the given choices. After your each turn, the environment will give you immediate feedback based on which you plan your next few steps. if the environment output "Nothing happened", that means the previous action is invalid and you should try more options.
 Reminder:
1. the action must be chosen from the given available actions. Any actions except provided available actions will be regarded as illegal.
2. Always call the tool to hand in your next action and think when necessary.

The action you would like to take should be offered in this format: "the name of your next action", and you should fill it in the argument field of your tool call. 2. Always call the tool to hand in your next action and think when necessary.

2. Always call the tool to hand in your next action and think when necessary.

The way you perform action is to place the action chosen by you in the arguments field of your tool call. For each of your turn, you will be given a list of actions which you can choose one to perform in this turn. The action you would like to take should be offered in this format: "the name of your next action", and you should fill it in the argument field of your tool call. Note that you should always call a tool to operate an action from the given choices. After your each turn, the environment will give you immediate feedback based on which you plan your next few steps. if the environment output "Nothing happened", that means the previous action is invalid and you should try more options.

1. the action must be chosen from the given available actions. Any actions except provided available actions will be regarded as illegal.
2. Always call the tool to hand in your next action and think when necessary.

Interact with a household to solve a task. Imagine you are an intelligent agent in a household environment and your target is to perform actions to complete) the task goal. At the beginning of your interactions, you will be given the detailed description of the current environment and your goal to accomplish. A tool will be provided for you to use to submit the action you want to take. This tool is the only tool you should and must take in order to operate any action in the environment. The way you perform action is to place the action chosen by you in the arguments field of your tool call. For each of your turn, you will be given a list of actions which you can choose one to perform in this turn. The action you would like to take should be offered in this format: "the name of your next action", and you should fill it in the argument field of your tool call. Note that you should always call a tool to operate an action from the given choices. After your each turn, the environment will give you immediate feedback based on which you plan your next few steps. if the environment output "Nothing happened", that means the previous action is invalid and you should try more options.
 Reminder:
1. the action must be chosen from the given available actions. Any actions except provided available actions will be regarded as illegal.
2. Always call the tool to hand in your next action and think when necessary.

Interact with a household to solve a task. Imagine you are an intelligent agent in a household environment and your target is to perform actions to complete) the task goal. At the beginning of your interactions, you will be given the detailed description of the current environment and your goal to accomplish. A tool will be provided for you to use to submit the action you want to take. This tool is the only tool you should and must take in order to operate any action in the environment. The way you perform action is to place the action chosen by you in the arguments field of your tool call. For each of your turn, you will be given a list of actions which you can choose one to perform in this turn. The action you would like to take should be offered in this format: "the name of your next action", and you should fill it in the argument field of your tool call. Note that you should always call a tool to operate an action from the given choices. After your each turn, the environment will give you immediate feedback based on which you plan your next few steps. if the environment output "Nothing happened", that means the previous action is invalid and you should try more options.
 Reminder:
1. the action must be chosen from the given available actions. Any actions except provided available actions will be regarded as illegal.
2. Always call the tool to hand in your next action and think when necessary.

Interact with a household to solve a task. Imagine you are an intelligent agent in a household environment and your target is to perform actions to complete) the task goal. At the beginning of your interactions, you will be given the detailed description of the current environment and your goal to accomplish. A tool will be provided for you to use to submit the action you want to take. This tool is the only tool you should and must take in order to operate any action in the environment. The way you perform action is to place the action chosen by you in the arguments field of your tool call. For each of your turn, you will be given a list of actions which you can choose one to perform in this turn. The action you would like to take should be offered in this format: "the name of your next action", and you should fill it in the argument field of your tool call. Note that you should always call a tool to operate an action from the given choices. After your each turn, the environment will give you immediate feedback based on which you plan your next few steps. if the environment output "Nothing happened", that means the previous action is invalid and you should try more options.
 Reminder:
1. the action must be chosen from the given available actions. Any actions except provided available actions will be regarded as illegal.
2. Always call the tool to hand in your next action and think when necessary.

Interact with a household to solve a task. Imagine you are an intelligent agent in a household environment and your target is to perform actions to complete) the task goal. At the beginning of your interactions, you will be given the detailed description of the current environment and your goal to accomplish. A tool will be provided for you to use to submit the action you want to take. This tool is the only tool you should and must take in order to operate any action in the environment. The way you perform action is to place the action chosen by you in the arguments field of your tool call. For each of your turn, you will be given a list of actions which you can choose one to perform in this turn. The action you would like to take should be offered in this format: "the name of your next action", and you should fill it in the argument field of your tool call. Note that you should always call a tool to operate an action from the given choices. After your each turn, the environment will give you immediate feedback based on which you plan your next few steps. if the environment output "Nothing happened", that means the previous action is invalid and you should try more options.
 Reminder:
1. the action must be chosen from the given available actions. Any actions except provided available actions will be regarded as illegal.
2. Always call the tool to hand in your next action and think when necessary.

messages.content:
Interact with a household to solve a task. Imagine you are an intelligent agent in a household environment and your target is to perform actions to complete) the task goal. At the beginning of your interactions, you will be given the detailed description of the current environment and your goal to accomplish. A tool will be provided for you to use to submit the action you want to take. This tool is the only tool you should and must take in order to operate any action in the environment. The way you perform action is to place the action chosen by you in the arguments field of your tool call. For each of your turn, you will be given a list of actions which you can choose one to perform in this turn. The action you would like to take should be offered in this format: "the name of your next action", and you should fill it in the argument field of your tool call. Note that you should always call a tool to operate an action from the given choices. After your each turn, the environment will give you immediate feedback based on which you plan your next few steps. if the environment output "Nothing happened", that means the previous action is invalid and you should try more options.
 Reminder:
1. the action must be chosen from the given available actions. Any actions except provided available actions will be regarded as illegal.
2. Always call the tool to hand in your next action and think when necessary.

Interact with a household to solve a task. Imagine you are an intelligent agent in a household environment and your target is to perform actions to complete) the task goal. At the beginning of your interactions, you will be given the detailed description of the current environment and your goal to accomplish. A tool will be provided for you to use to submit the action you want to take. This tool is the only tool you should and must take in order to operate any action in the environment. The way you perform action is to place the action chosen by you in the arguments field of your tool call. For each of your turn, you will be given a list of actions which you can choose one to perform in this turn. The action you would like to take should be offered in this format: "the name of your next action", and you should fill it in the argument field of your tool call. Note that you should always call a tool to operate an action from the given choices. After your each turn, the environment will give you immediate feedback based on which you plan your next few steps. if the environment output "Nothing happened", that means the previous action is invalid and you should try more options.
 Reminder:
1. the action must be chosen from the given available actions. Any actions except provided available actions will be regarded as illegal.
2. Always call the tool to hand in your next action and think when necessary.

The action you would like to take should be offered in this format: "the name of your next action", and you should fill it in the argument field of your tool call. After your each turn, the environment will give you immediate feedback based on which you plan your next few steps. if the environment output "Nothing happened", that means the previous action is invalid and you should try more options.

2. Always call the tool to hand in your next action and think when necessary.

messages.content:
Interact with a household to solve a task. Imagine you are an intelligent agent in a household environment and your target is to perform actions to complete) the task goal. At the beginning of your interactions, you will be given the detailed description of the current environment and your goal to accomplish. A tool will be provided for you to use to submit the action you want to take. This tool is the only tool you should and must take in order to operate any action in the environment. The way you perform action is to place the action chosen by you in the arguments field of your tool call. For each of your turn, you will be given a list of actions which you can choose one to perform in this turn. The action you would like to take should be offered in this format: "the name of your next action", and you should fill it in the argument field of your tool call. Note that you should always call a tool to operate an action from the given choices. After your each turn, the environment will give you immediate feedback based on which you plan your next few steps. if the environment output "Nothing happened", that means the previous action is invalid and you should try more options.
 Reminder:
1. the action must be chosen from the given available actions. Any actions except provided available actions will be regarded as illegal.
2. Always call the tool to hand in your next action and think when necessary.
